page.title: 11EDUCATION IN SUMMERSEAT
page.content: Summerseat has a residential school which educates children with emotional and behavioural problems. There are 13 residential and 19 day pupils aged between 9 and 15 years old.They are organised into 4 classes. The children are transferred from other schools in the Bury area and are monitored by psychological and special needs advisers.There is a head, deputy, 4 teachers, 4 house staff and 2 ancillary helpers. The school day is from 9 to 3.30 p.m. After this time the residents play, have tea and do their homework.There are organised games and activities between 6 and 7 p.m. and from 7 p.m. until bedtimeis free time.Each week the children are graded according to their behaviour.Children who abscond have to wear red shorts and have to go bare-foot for repeated offences.
